climatePledgeFriendly.details: Pre-owned Certified: Electronics products are inspected, cleaned and (if applicable) repaired to excellent functional standards. Buying Pre-owned extends a product's life, reducing e-waste and raw material extraction.

body.description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works with no glitches
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace a more expensive and modern Belkin router which I had purchased 3 months previously. In that time we had numerous wifi outages, had to reset the router and reconnect all our connected appliances, it was tedious.Since we plugged this guy in we have had zero outages, I had previously owned a NetGear router and I think I will stick with this brand, they are dependable and the dashboard is easy to follow, I have never had to revisit it since turning it on and that's a testament to the ease of use and stability of the product.Speed wise I play xbox and xbox one multiplayer games and they are flying through, I also have some network extenders around my house and so far everyone seems to play well with each other.If you want something that you switch on and then don't have to worry about, then get this, I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars You are on your own for installation
reviews.reviewText: If you know how to install a router without any assistance, this is probably a good product. I was disappointed to discover that the product came without instructions, support or an installation CD. The only documentation was a little piece of paper directing me to the Netgear website where I would find the installation wizard download and instructions. There is no download and the only instructions were some basic wiring diagrams followed by "then insert the installation CD." The telephone support would not help because the unit was "REFURB" which I didn't realize until after placing the order. The free email support was a computer generated response that was totally useless. But there was a happy ending due to an incredible coincidence. My roommate's computer tech showed up to repair her computer just as I was packing up the router for return. He had the router up and running in less than 10 minutes, without the installation CD and completely disregarding the Netgear website. As for the router... it is working fine. It is much faster and provides a much stronger signal than the deceased Linksys that I purchased just six months ago. I just hope I don't have to install it again or need support. But now I know what "manufacturer refurbished" means.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Great router unless you want wireless.
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this product while I was deployed to Afghanistan. When I finally returned home and plugged it in, it worked exceptionally well for about 2 weeks. Then my wireless signal failed to the point that I currently have 25% signal strength from 3 feet away. I've spent over a month working with Netgear support trying to get the issue resolved or the unit replaced, but it's a hardware problem and they do not support refurbished products. In the end, it is beyond my 90 day return window and Netgear won't do anything for me, so I spent $ 6 0 on a standard gigabit router. This does me absolutely no good at all.I purchased this product because of Netgear's good name. After the unit failed, I searched and discovered this is an extremely common problem with this series. Don't get screwed, but a different brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice product with wonderful features
reviews.reviewText: The router is nice with some cool features. There are a lot of other routers that you can find if you are just looking for dual band routers (with or without USB). But this one is OpenWRT and DDWRT supported router. Spend your money on this if you are interested in attaching a network drive and stream media from that drive. I love watching movies over DLNA, network share etc. and this solves the purpose. For fun you can also host your http and/or ftp servers over internet.One thing though, the writing is not very nice over the network. for example if you are transferring your media from your laptop to the network drive, dont expect superfast speed. Go for a higher CPU based router for that.Its been a month using the router and no issues with it, yet :)EDIT.....after 1.5 months i mistakenly disconnected the router power supply and found that router was unable to connect to the internet. I tried to debug it for 3 hrs, it was definitely frustrating. Finally when i was about to give up i thought of directly connecting to modem and try upgrading my firmware (i dont know how i thought of this even when router always showed me that there was no router update before it went rogue). So, i downloaded and did the upgrade and it started working. Dont know why but it is working now.Reduced the rating from 5 to 4 stars because of frustration. agh...--------------------------On a different note: if you are planning to host a file server on the router (via the USB port on the router) let me warn you that the file transfer rate it not impressive. Might be something like 1.5 MBytes/sec. so it might be good for a 1080p movie but not when u are taking periodic backups of files like 20 GBs. Get a router with a good processor for that. Although the network speed is super fast, u need not worry about that

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars After 20 months of use, unit has died.
reviews.reviewText: I had high hopes for this router after reading the positive reviews a couple years ago. I was tired of my old D-Link and was ready to spend the extra bucks for a better, newer modem. Unfortunately, the modem never rose too much above average. I had to reset it every other month, and the guest network always had problems allowing connections. The range and speed were good, when it worked right, but I think products like this should last much longer. Cannot recommend for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best budget router!
reviews.reviewText: Although this listing is for the manufacturer refurbished version, there's not much of a difference from buying it new. If I remember correctly, it came with a ethernet cable, a few papers, and a cd. It has one Ethernet in, four Ethernet out, and USB port. Router runs fine 24/7 for the past 6th months without needing to restart as other reviewers have stated. Setup was a breeze, got wireless working after a few minutes. There's an option to use the 5.0Ghz wireless network which works fine as well. I purchased this through EMBIZ.

Range is same as my last bottom line Belkin Router. I was disappointed with range. Speed and connectivity are in improvement from my last cheap router.It has 5.1 ghz but only our ipad supports. None of our phones or my laptops support.
Easy to install but very poor coverage
